episodeTitle: Battle Against Giants! Open the Second Gate!
episodeTitleJapanese: 巨人族との攻防！第2の門を開けろ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kyojin-zoku to no Kōbō! Dai Ni no Mon o Akero!
description: The Franky Family and Galley-La Company work together to defeat the giant guard Kashii. Meanwhile, CP9 holds their first reunion in five years, with Fukurou measuring everyone's power levels using his Te-awase technique, revealing Rob Lucci as the strongest with 4000 doriki.

events.title: Franky Family and Galley-La Attack Kashii
events.description: The Franky Family and Galley-La Company launch a coordinated attack against the giant guard Kashii at the main gate of Enies Lobby. Multiple members work together to bring down the massive opponent.
events.significance: Demonstrates the alliance between former rivals (Franky Family and Galley-La) working together to breach Enies Lobby's defenses.

events.title: Sentei Kaitai Giri Debut
events.description: Mozu and Kiwi use their technique 'Sentei Kaitai Giri' to cut Kashii's left shoe, causing the giant to slip and lose his balance.
events.significance: First appearance of this Franky Family twin attack technique, crucial to defeating Kashii.

quotes.speaker: Mozu and Kiwi
quotes.context: Cutting Kashii's shoe to make him slip

events.title: Timber Hitch Tug Debut
events.description: Paulie uses his rope technique 'Timber Hitch Tug' to pull Kashii backwards by his hair after the giant has been unbalanced.
events.significance: Demonstrates Paulie's skill with rope techniques in the coordinated assault against Kashii.

quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Pulling Kashii backwards with his ropes

events.title: Trunnel Lock Debut
events.description: Peepley Lulu and Tilestone use 'Trunnel Lock' to nail Kashii's face to the wall after he has been brought down, securing his defeat.
events.significance: Final technique in the coordinated assault, showing Galley-La Company's carpentry skills in combat.

events.title: Kashii Defeated
events.description: Through the combined efforts of the Franky Family and Galley-La Company, the giant guard Kashii is defeated and immobilized. Zambai delivers the final blow with a bazooka shot to his face.
events.significance: The allied forces successfully defeat one of the giant gatekeepers, allowing them to advance toward the second gate of Enies Lobby.

events.title: Oimo's Rage at Kashii's Defeat
events.description: After witnessing his fellow giant guard Kashii being defeated and nailed to the wall, Oimo becomes enraged and attempts to strike the Franky Family and Galley-La members with his club, but accidentally hits Kashii instead when they dodge.
events.significance: Shows the bond between the two giant guards and escalates the conflict at the main gate.

events.title: CP9 First Reunion in Five Years
events.description: The CP9 agents gather together for the first time in five years at Enies Lobby. The reunion includes Rob Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, Jabra, Blueno, Kumadori, and Fukurou, with some tensions and banter among members.
events.significance: Establishes that CP9 members were on separate missions for five years before reuniting at Enies Lobby, providing context for their relationships and dynamics.

events.title: Gatherine Mentioned
events.description: Gatherine, a cafeteria worker at Enies Lobby, is mentioned by Fukurou when he reveals that Jabra was rejected by her the previous day, explaining Jabra's bad mood during the CP9 reunion.
events.significance: First mention of Gatherine, who becomes a source of romantic rivalry within CP9, particularly between Jabra and Rob Lucci. Reveals that Gatherine only cares about men for their looks.

events.title: Fukurou's Te-awase Debut
events.description: Fukurou demonstrates his unique technique 'Te-awase' which allows him to measure the physical power level (doriki) of individuals. He uses this technique to measure all CP9 members' strength.
events.significance: Introduces the doriki measurement system to the series, providing a concrete way to compare physical strength levels. Te-awase is unique to Fukurou and he is the only known user of this ability.

events.title: Doriki System Introduced
events.description: The doriki measurement system is introduced as a unit to measure physical power levels. It is explained that an average armed Marine soldier has 10 doriki, and anyone with 500 or higher is considered superhuman.
events.significance: Establishes a power scaling system that helps viewers understand the relative strength of CP9 members and their opponents. This system becomes important for understanding the difficulty of upcoming battles.

quotes.text: An average armed soldier has about 10 doriki. Anyone with 500 or higher is superhuman!
quotes.speaker: Spandam

events.title: Kalifa's Doriki: 630
events.description: Fukurou measures Kalifa's physical power at 630 doriki, making her the weakest CP9 fighter but still far above superhuman level.
events.significance: Establishes Kalifa as the least physically powerful CP9 agent, though she is still incredibly strong by normal standards.

events.title: Fukurou's Doriki: 800
events.description: Fukurou reveals his own physical power level at 800 doriki.
events.significance: Establishes Fukurou as one of the mid-tier CP9 fighters in terms of raw physical strength.

events.title: Kumadori's Doriki: 810
events.description: Fukurou measures Kumadori's physical power at 810 doriki, placing him slightly above Fukurou.
events.significance: Establishes Kumadori as another mid-tier CP9 fighter, marginally stronger than Fukurou.

events.title: Blueno's Doriki: 820
events.description: Fukurou measures Blueno's physical power at 820 doriki, making him slightly stronger than Kumadori.
events.significance: Establishes Blueno as a mid-tier CP9 fighter, notable for his Door-Door Fruit powers which aren't measured by doriki.

events.title: Jabra's Doriki: 2180
events.description: Fukurou measures Jabra's physical power at 2180 doriki, revealing him as one of the top three strongest CP9 fighters.
events.significance: Establishes Jabra as significantly stronger than the mid-tier CP9 members, making him one of the three strongest agents.

events.title: Kaku's Doriki: 2200
events.description: Fukurou measures Kaku's physical power at 2200 doriki, placing him just barely above Jabra as the second strongest CP9 fighter.
events.significance: Establishes Kaku as the second strongest CP9 agent in terms of raw physical power, creating rivalry with Jabra who is only 20 doriki below him.

events.title: Rob Lucci's Doriki: 4000
events.description: Fukurou measures Rob Lucci's physical power at 4000 doriki, revealing him as by far the strongest CP9 agent with nearly double the power of the second-place Kaku.
events.significance: Establishes Rob Lucci as the overwhelmingly strongest member of CP9, with a power level that dwarfs even Kaku and Jabra. This moment sets up Lucci as the ultimate opponent the Straw Hats will face at Enies Lobby.

events.title: Spandam's Doriki: 9
events.description: It is revealed that Spandam, the leader of CP9, has a doriki of only 9, making him weaker than even an average Marine soldier.
events.significance: Emphasizes that Spandam's power comes from his authority and political connections, not physical strength. This creates an interesting dynamic where the weakest member commands the strongest agents.

events.title: Spandam Receives Incomplete Intelligence on Luffy
events.description: Spandam receives an incomplete intelligence report suggesting that Monkey D. Luffy is no longer a threat, leading him to underestimate the approaching Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Sets up Spandam's false sense of security and overconfidence, which will be shattered when the Straw Hats arrive at full strength.

events.title: Spandam Commends CP9
events.description: Spandam praises the CP9 agents for successfully capturing Nico Robin and Franky, congratulating them on completing their five-year mission in Water 7.
events.significance: Acknowledges the success of CP9's infiltration mission and sets up the conflict as the Straw Hats work to rescue their captured crewmate and ally.

events.title: Rocketman Approaches Enies Lobby
events.description: The Rocketman sea train carrying Luffy, the Straw Hats, and their allies continues its approach toward Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Builds tension as the rescue mission draws closer to the World Government stronghold.

quotes.text: An average armed soldier has about 10 doriki. Anyone with 500 or higher is superhuman!
quotes.speaker: Spandam

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how the Franky Family and Galley-La Company, despite being former rivals, successfully defeat the giant Kashii through coordinated teamwork. No single individual could have defeated him alone.
themes.symbolism: The coordinated attack on Kashii symbolizes how the various allies of the Straw Hats must work together to overcome the World Government's forces.

themes.description: The introduction of the doriki system provides a concrete measurement of strength, revealing the strict hierarchy within CP9 and emphasizing the challenge the Straw Hats will face.
themes.symbolism: The doriki measurements represent the World Government's systematic and bureaucratic approach to power, contrasting with the Straw Hats' more chaotic and unpredictable strength.

themes.description: Spandam's incomplete intelligence leads him to underestimate Luffy and the Straw Hats, showcasing the dangerous overconfidence of those in power.
themes.symbolism: Spandam's weak doriki yet high position represents how authority doesn't always correlate with actual strength or competence.

characterSpotlights.development: Rob Lucci is established as the overwhelmingly strongest CP9 agent with 4000 doriki, setting him up as the ultimate opponent at Enies Lobby.
keyActions: Revealed to be nearly twice as strong as the second-strongest CP9 member

characterSpotlights.development: Fukurou demonstrates his unique Te-awase ability, providing crucial information about CP9's strength levels and establishing the doriki system.
keyActions: Uses Te-awase to measure all CP9 members

characterSpotlights.development: Kashii is defeated through the coordinated efforts of the Franky Family and Galley-La Company, demonstrating that even giants can be overcome through teamwork and strategy.
keyActions: Guards the main gate of Enies Lobby
Defeated by coordinated attack from multiple opponents
Nailed to the wall after being brought down

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam is shown to be the weakest member of CP9 with only 9 doriki, yet he commands the powerful agents and underestimates the approaching Straw Hats due to incomplete intelligence.
keyActions: Commends CP9 for capturing Robin and Franky
quotes: An average armed soldier has about 10 doriki. Anyone with 500 or higher is superhuman!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added scenes of Robin reflecting on her memories with the Straw Hats that were not in the original manga chapters.
The anime showed Luffy using Gomu Gomu no Fusen to escape from Marines, which was not depicted in the manga chapters covered.
Animation error: The Franky Family boat was incorrectly labeled as 'Frnky' and 'Eranky' instead of 'Franky'.

trivia.fact: This episode introduces the doriki measurement system, which is unique to the CP9 arc and is never used again in the series after Enies Lobby.
Rob Lucci's doriki of 4000 is the highest ever measured in the series, making him the strongest character whose power level was officially quantified using this system.
This episode had a TV rating of 10.2% in Japan, ranking 5th for its time slot.
The ending song 'Adventure World' would be the last ending theme used in One Piece for 17 years, as the anime switched to using only opening themes after episode 278.
Gatherine is only mentioned in this episode but never actually appears on screen, making her one of the few debuting characters to be introduced through dialogue alone.
Fukurou is voiced by the same voice actor (Masaya Onosaka) who also voices Spandam in the Japanese version.
